title: Solar-Powered School Electrification
challenge: A primary school serving 400 students had no reliable electricity, limiting teaching hours and preventing use of educational technology. High energy costs from diesel generators were unsustainable for the school budget.
approach: We conducted an energy audit and co-designed a solar solution with school administrators, teachers, and the parent-teacher association. We facilitated access to clean energy financing, supervised installation, and trained staff in system maintenance. We also integrated energy education into the school curriculum.
outcomes: Installed 15kW solar system providing 100% daytime power needs
Reduced school energy costs by 78% annually
Extended teaching hours by 3 hours daily with evening classes
Created 2 local jobs for system maintenance
